snippet: Two seamen who recently spent time on the El Faro said the cargo ship had experienced safety problems while they worked onboard.

byline.contributor: Frances Robles reported from Jacksonville, and Lizette Alvarez from Miami.
byline.original: By FRANCES ROBLES and LIZETTE ALVAREZ

abstract: New questions arise about sinking of container ship El Faro, which ventured into Hurricane Joaquin, including aging vessel's safety standards and possible pressure over its cargo delivery schedule; Coast Guard has not recovered bodies of any of 33 crew members aboard; National Transportation Safety Board has begun investigation with which ship's owner Tote Maritime Puerto Rico say it will fully cooperate.
lead_paragraph: Two seamen who recently spent time on the El Faro said the cargo ship had experienced safety problems while they worked onboard.

headline.print_headline: Questions Are Raised About Safety on Ship That Sank in Storm
headline.main: Questions Are Raised About Safety on Ship Missing After Storm
